sections.description:
Glocal elements style default HTML Elements and user generated content or WYSIWYG editors. It also includes common patterns that are reused thoughout the site like Typography, Images, SVGs, Forms, Lists, and print styles.

Uses Hacked Version of Normalize 1.99

Naming Patterns

 p ul li (Default HTML Elements)
.g-global-style__element
.g-global-style--modifier
.g-global-style--modifier__element
.g-global-style__element--modifier
Unit / Generic Functions

Converts units from pixels to REMs or EMs

$px - Pixel Size

.component__wrapper {
  max-width: rem(30px);
}
.component__wrapper {
  max-width: em(30px);
}

Strips units (From Foundation Zurb Base File)

$value : strip-unit(20rem); // $value is 20

"RU" is short hand for "Rhythm Unit"

Simple Vertical Rhythm Function - Returns a REM unit that is a fraction of the line-height of the body. This is Useful for maitaining a vertical rhythm in your layouts. Typically using round fractions or mutlipliers (1/4, 1/2, 1, 1.5, 2).

$rhythm-units - Units of "leading" defined by default line-height

Assuming:

$base-line-height: 24px;
$base-font-size: 16px;

Example:

.component__wrapper {
  padding: ru(0.5) ru(1.25);
}

Is rendered in CSS as

.component__wrapper {
  padding: 0.75rem 1.875rem; // 12px / 30px
}

"DBL" is short hand for "DeBug Layout"

Mixin for development only. Create a highly visisble background fill, outline, and on an element. Each call increments though the an array of colors. Usefull for positioning layouts and components while doing front end work.

Mixin translates Photoshop Style drop shadow values to native CSS box / text shadows

All Attributes should match the values in Photoshop

@mixin photoshop-drop-shadow ($angle: 0, $distance: 0, $spread: 0, $size: 0, $color: $black, $inner: false) {

@mixin photoshop-inner-shadow ($angle: 0, $distance: 0, $spread: 0, $size: 0, $color: $black) {

@mixin photoshop-text-shadow ($angle: 0, $distance: 0, $spread: 0, $size: 0, $color: $black) {

NOTE: $spread has no effect for text shadows

Default breakpoints.

expanded-wrapper  =>   400px
type-large        =>   600px
full-nav          =>   900px
max-size          =>  1200px

sections.description:
Stores colors in easy to remember array names. Based on http://erskinedesign.com/blog/friendlier-colour-names-sass-maps/

Requires: $palette (map) - see _g-color--variables.scss

@function palette ($palette, $tone:'base')

$palette - Base Color
$tone - Shade variation of Base Color

a {
  color: palette(purple);
  &:hover {
    color: palette(purple, light);
  }
}

Default @viewport for responsive.

Default HTML / Body resets. Body has Flex display to allow footer (or main) to scale full hieght of viewport
Example "Kitchen Sink" Content

sections.description:
Responsive Typography Based on http://www.smashingmagazine.com/2015/06/responsive-typography-with-sass-maps/ Modified to use REM & https://github.com/at-import/breakpoint

Requires:

  • $breakpoints to be defined as a map in /layouts/_l--breakpoints.scss
  • Typography Maps to be defined in g-type--variables.scss

$fs-map - Defined Range of Font sizes $fs-breakpoints - Optional: Specify a specific breakpoint

.g-type--h3 {
  @include font-size($h3-font-sizes);
}
Arrays of Font Sizing which change at breakpoints See /layouts/l--breakpoints.scss
Fonts these are all the default @fontface declarations
Type Variants

Puts an fixed SVG inside a container of a specific size

svg-centered($svg-width, $svg-height, $wrapper-width, $wrapper-height, $svg-class: svg)

 
$svg-width           - Width of the SVG Icon
$svg-height          - Height of the SVG Icon
$wrapper-width       - Width of the container
$wrapper-height      - Height of the container
$svg-class:'.g-svg'  - SVG class '.g-svg' by default
$x-offset:0          - % horizontal offset from center
$y-offset:0          - % vertical offset from center
$layout-mode:'margin'- 'margin' or 'transform' Center SVG with fixed margins or css transform
                       IE 11 / Safari 9 has a bug which trasform uses up space

Puts an fixed SVG inside a container of a specific size

svg-inline($baseline, $svg-width, $svg-height, $svg-pad-right, $svg-pad-left, $container-vertical-padding, $container-padding-right: 0, $container-padding-left: 0, $svg-class: 'svg', $h-alignment: 'left', $v-alignment: 'middle')

 
$baseline                        - Font baseline
$svg-width                       - Width of the SVG Icon
$svg-height                      - Height of the SVG Icon
$svg-pad-right                   - Padding on right side of SVG
$svg-pad-left                    - Padding on left side of SVG
$container-vertical-padding      - Top & bottom padding for container
$container-padding-right: 0      - Right padding for container
$container-padding-left: 0       - Left and right padding for container
$svg-class: 'g-svg'                - Class for the SVG inside the parent
$h-alignment: 'left'             - Align Icon on 'left' or 'right'
$v-alignment: 'middle'           - Align Icon 'middle' or 'top'

sections.description: Hacked version of Normalize used as a base reset. Last Duplicated w/ v5.0.3 https://github.com/JohnAlbin/normalize-scss

Components are discreet parts of the UI. They general can scale to fit a range of sizes of containers (See Layouts).

Components can appear inside components. Components May adjust their own layouts depending on the size of their containers. This is typical done with eq.js script for element queries.

Naming Patterns

.c-component__element
.c-component--modifier
.c-component--modifier__element
.c-component__element--modifier

sections.description:
Custom Layouts

Layouts position components in a page. They often implenent width based Media queries in a mobile first strategy. Typically there is a layout partial for different regions in the website like the page (wrapper), header, footer, etc. These Layouts tend to be unique and not reusable.

Naming Patterns

.l-layout__element
.l-layout--variation
.l-layout--modifier__element
.l-layout__element--modifier
.l-header
.l-header__logo
.l-header__tagline
.l-header--sticky >> EG. the header is smaller & fixed postion when you scroll...
.l-header--sticky__logo

Reusable Layouts

Media Queries

Other layouts are reusable such as generic grid containers. These can be either (width) media query or eq.js based layouts. Column layouts express the number of columns with a "cols#" string, and a optionally a modifer which expresses the number of columns the layout has from smallest width to largest width.

Yes you can indeed used brackets and commas in css if you escape with a backslash

Media Query Patterns

.l-2cols >> 2 columns (equal width)
.l-2cols--1-2 >> 1 column @ default width, 2 columns @ larger width
.l-5col--1-2-5 >> 1 to 2 to 5 columns as the width increases
.l-2cols(25,75) >> 2 columns in ratio of 25% to 75%

eq.js

eq.js "breakpoints" are defined in HTML. This allows them to be more flexible as you can simply add or remove "data-eq-pts" in your data attibutes of the layout wrapper class. Details are in the eq.js docs.

<div class="l-eq" data-eq-pts="l-eq--2col: 400 l-eq--3col: 600"> CONTENT </div>

eq.js Patterns 

.l-eq--2cols >> 2 columns when
.l-eq--5cols

2 Column Layout @ 50% EACH           => %l-eq-2col__item

3 Column Layout @ 33% EACH           => %l-eq-3col__item

sections.description:
Generic modifier components. Oftern extended from other components. Each Utility should be very specific and do only 1 job. This seciton also documents Generic Mixins and Extendables

Utility Naming Patterns

.u-utility__element
.u-utility--modifier
.u-utility--modifier__element
.u-utility__element--modifier

Mixin Naming Patterns @TODO

Clearfix from http://cssmojo.com/latest_new_clearfix_so_far/

Use as a class or @extend.

 @extend %u-clearfix; 
 .u-clearfix

Basic styling used in lists Intended for Drupals default menu (ul.menu) / tabs formats to remove default Bullets & display as inline links.

.my-ul-class {
  @extend %u-inline-links;
}

Reset lists to have no bullets and default left padding

.my-ul-class {
  @extend %u-list--reset;
}

Reset lists to have no bullets, no padding or margins.

.my-ul-class {
  @extend %u-list--blank;
}

Remove top and bottom margin from childen elements in a container. This is useful for things like titles in WYSIWYG Fields.

Use as class or @extend (preferred)

 @extend %u-remove-child--margin-top; 
 @extend %u-remove-child--margin-bottom; 
 @extend %u-remove-child--margin-top-bottom; 
 .u-remove-child--margin-top; 
 .u-remove-child--margin-bottom; 
 .u-remove-child--margin-top-bottom;

Hides text in block elements using text-indent. Useful for accessibility in Icon links etc.

Use as class or @extend (preferred)

 @extend %u-text-hide; 
 .u-text-hide

Accessible way to hide elements on the page (and show them again)

Use as a mixin (discouraged), class, or @extend (preferred)

 .u-visually--hidden 
 @extend %u-visually--hidden; 
 @inlude visually-hidden; 
 .u-visually--shown 
 @extend %u-visually--hidden; 
 @inlclude visually-shown;

Animation Extends for CSS transitions

$transition-duration: 0.25s !default;

 @extend %u-animate-background-color 
 @extend %u-animate-color 
 @extend %u-animate-opacity 
 @extend %u-animate-all
Based on http://danielmall.com/articles/responsive-line-breaks/ span does a line break on smaller screens, On larger screens appears inline with a trailing pipe divider

sections.description:
Scoped Classes are dependant on the DOM creates a new styling context or Scope. Similar to a Theme, but not necessarily cosmetic, these should be used sparingly—they can be open to abuse and lead to poor CSS if not used wisely.

Scope Naming Patterns

.s-context
sections.css: @import 'scope/s-wysiwyg';

sections.description:
These are the styles that appear in a WYSIWYG editor. Project assumes all wysiwyg fields are wrapped with .s-wysiwyg

See g-links See g-lists
Put the css from 3rd parties libraries here. These files will not be linted.

variables.name: baseline
variables.value:
rem($base-line-height), // font baseline
    $svg-width: ru(0.75), // SVG width (units same as typography)
    $svg-height: ru(0.75), // SVG height
    $svg-pad-right: ru(0.25), // padding on right side of SVG
    $svg-pad-left: 0, // padding on left side of SVG
    $container-vertical-padding: ru(0.5), // Top & bottom padding for container
    $container-padding-left: ru(1), // Left padding for container
    $container-padding-right: ru(1), // Right padding for container    $svg-class: 'svg', // Class for the SVG inside the parent
    $svg-class: 'g-svg', // Class for the SVG inside the parent
    $h-alignment: 'left', // Align Icon on 'left' or 'right'
    $v-alignment: 'middle'

variables.name: baseline
variables.value:
rem($base-line-height), // font baseline
    $svg-width: ru(0.75), // SVG width (units same as typography)
    $svg-height: ru(0.75), // SVG height
    $svg-pad-right: 0, // padding on left side of SVG
    $svg-pad-left: ru(0.5), // padding on right side of SVG
    $container-vertical-padding: ru(0.5), // Top & bottom padding for container
    $container-padding-left: ru(1), // Left padding for container
    $container-padding-right: ru(0.75), // Right padding for container
    $svg-class: 'g-svg', // Class for the SVG inside the parent
    $h-alignment: 'right', // Align Icon on 'left' or 'right'
    $v-alignment: 'top'

(
  grey: (
    base: $color-grey-base,
    xdark: darken($color-grey-base, 30%),
    dark: darken($color-grey-base, 20%),

    xlight: lighten($color-grey-base, 20%),
  ),

  blue: (
    base: #3f3fb1,

    light: #7c7fb1,
    xlight: #cce0ff
  )
)

variables.name: palettes

(
  purple: (
    base: rgb(42, 40, 80),

    dark: rgb(40, 38, 65)
  ),
  grey: (
    base:  $color-base-grey,
    light: lighten($color-base-grey, 10%),
    dark: darken($color-base-grey, 10%)
  )
) !default

section.description:
Glocal elements style default HTML Elements and user generated content or WYSIWYG editors. It also includes common patterns that are reused thoughout the site like Typography, Images, SVGs, Forms, Lists, and print styles.

Uses Hacked Version of Normalize 1.99

Naming Patterns

 p ul li (Default HTML Elements)
.g-global-style__element
.g-global-style--modifier
.g-global-style--modifier__element
.g-global-style__element--modifier
Unit / Generic Functions

Converts units from pixels to REMs or EMs

$px - Pixel Size

.component__wrapper {
  max-width: rem(30px);
}
.component__wrapper {
  max-width: em(30px);
}

Strips units (From Foundation Zurb Base File)

$value : strip-unit(20rem); // $value is 20

"RU" is short hand for "Rhythm Unit"

Simple Vertical Rhythm Function - Returns a REM unit that is a fraction of the line-height of the body. This is Useful for maitaining a vertical rhythm in your layouts. Typically using round fractions or mutlipliers (1/4, 1/2, 1, 1.5, 2).

$rhythm-units - Units of "leading" defined by default line-height

Assuming:

$base-line-height: 24px;
$base-font-size: 16px;

Example:

.component__wrapper {
  padding: ru(0.5) ru(1.25);
}

Is rendered in CSS as

.component__wrapper {
  padding: 0.75rem 1.875rem; // 12px / 30px
}

"DBL" is short hand for "DeBug Layout"

Mixin for development only. Create a highly visisble background fill, outline, and on an element. Each call increments though the an array of colors. Usefull for positioning layouts and components while doing front end work.

Mixin translates Photoshop Style drop shadow values to native CSS box / text shadows

All Attributes should match the values in Photoshop

@mixin photoshop-drop-shadow ($angle: 0, $distance: 0, $spread: 0, $size: 0, $color: $black, $inner: false) {

@mixin photoshop-inner-shadow ($angle: 0, $distance: 0, $spread: 0, $size: 0, $color: $black) {

@mixin photoshop-text-shadow ($angle: 0, $distance: 0, $spread: 0, $size: 0, $color: $black) {

NOTE: $spread has no effect for text shadows

Default breakpoints.

expanded-wrapper  =>   400px
type-large        =>   600px
full-nav          =>   900px
max-size          =>  1200px

modifiers.name: $black
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

modifiers.name: $white
modifiers.markup: {$modifiers}
modifiers.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

section.markup: {$modifiers}
section.renderMarkup: {$modifiers}

section.description:
Stores colors in easy to remember array names. Based on http://erskinedesign.com/blog/friendlier-colour-names-sass-maps/

Requires: $palette (map) - see _g-color--variables.scss

@function palette ($palette, $tone:'base')

$palette - Base Color
$tone - Shade variation of Base Color

a {
  color: palette(purple);
  &:hover {
    color: palette(purple, light);
  }
}

Default @viewport for responsive.

Default HTML / Body resets. Body has Flex display to allow footer (or main) to scale full hieght of viewport
Example "Kitchen Sink" Content

section.description:
Responsive Typography Based on http://www.smashingmagazine.com/2015/06/responsive-typography-with-sass-maps/ Modified to use REM & https://github.com/at-import/breakpoint

Requires:

  • $breakpoints to be defined as a map in /layouts/_l--breakpoints.scss
  • Typography Maps to be defined in g-type--variables.scss

$fs-map - Defined Range of Font sizes $fs-breakpoints - Optional: Specify a specific breakpoint

.g-type--h3 {
  @include font-size($h3-font-sizes);
}
Arrays of Font Sizing which change at breakpoints See /layouts/l--breakpoints.scss
Fonts these are all the default @fontface declarations
Type Variants

section.description: TODO: What does this do?

Puts an fixed SVG inside a container of a specific size

svg-centered($svg-width, $svg-height, $wrapper-width, $wrapper-height, $svg-class: svg)

 
$svg-width           - Width of the SVG Icon
$svg-height          - Height of the SVG Icon
$wrapper-width       - Width of the container
$wrapper-height      - Height of the container
$svg-class:'.g-svg'  - SVG class '.g-svg' by default
$x-offset:0          - % horizontal offset from center
$y-offset:0          - % vertical offset from center
$layout-mode:'margin'- 'margin' or 'transform' Center SVG with fixed margins or css transform
                       IE 11 / Safari 9 has a bug which trasform uses up space

Puts an fixed SVG inside a container of a specific size

svg-inline($baseline, $svg-width, $svg-height, $svg-pad-right, $svg-pad-left, $container-vertical-padding, $container-padding-right: 0, $container-padding-left: 0, $svg-class: 'svg', $h-alignment: 'left', $v-alignment: 'middle')

 
$baseline                        - Font baseline
$svg-width                       - Width of the SVG Icon
$svg-height                      - Height of the SVG Icon
$svg-pad-right                   - Padding on right side of SVG
$svg-pad-left                    - Padding on left side of SVG
$container-vertical-padding      - Top & bottom padding for container
$container-padding-right: 0      - Right padding for container
$container-padding-left: 0       - Left and right padding for container
$svg-class: 'g-svg'                - Class for the SVG inside the parent
$h-alignment: 'left'             - Align Icon on 'left' or 'right'
$v-alignment: 'middle'           - Align Icon 'middle' or 'top'

section.description: Hacked version of Normalize used as a base reset. Last Duplicated w/ v5.0.3 https://github.com/JohnAlbin/normalize-scss

Components are discreet parts of the UI. They general can scale to fit a range of sizes of containers (See Layouts).

Components can appear inside components. Components May adjust their own layouts depending on the size of their containers. This is typical done with eq.js script for element queries.

Naming Patterns

.c-component__element
.c-component--modifier
.c-component--modifier__element
.c-component__element--modifier

section.description:
Custom Layouts

Layouts position components in a page. They often implenent width based Media queries in a mobile first strategy. Typically there is a layout partial for different regions in the website like the page (wrapper), header, footer, etc. These Layouts tend to be unique and not reusable.

Naming Patterns

.l-layout__element
.l-layout--variation
.l-layout--modifier__element
.l-layout__element--modifier
.l-header
.l-header__logo
.l-header__tagline
.l-header--sticky >> EG. the header is smaller & fixed postion when you scroll...
.l-header--sticky__logo

Reusable Layouts

Media Queries

Other layouts are reusable such as generic grid containers. These can be either (width) media query or eq.js based layouts. Column layouts express the number of columns with a "cols#" string, and a optionally a modifer which expresses the number of columns the layout has from smallest width to largest width.

Yes you can indeed used brackets and commas in css if you escape with a backslash

Media Query Patterns

.l-2cols >> 2 columns (equal width)
.l-2cols--1-2 >> 1 column @ default width, 2 columns @ larger width
.l-5col--1-2-5 >> 1 to 2 to 5 columns as the width increases
.l-2cols(25,75) >> 2 columns in ratio of 25% to 75%

eq.js

eq.js "breakpoints" are defined in HTML. This allows them to be more flexible as you can simply add or remove "data-eq-pts" in your data attibutes of the layout wrapper class. Details are in the eq.js docs.

<div class="l-eq" data-eq-pts="l-eq--2col: 400 l-eq--3col: 600"> CONTENT </div>

eq.js Patterns 

.l-eq--2cols >> 2 columns when
.l-eq--5cols
.l-eq--2col--1-2(60,40)  >> 1 to 2 columns. 2 columns in ratio of 60% 40% .

l-eq column variations

2 Column Layout @ 50% EACH           => %l-eq-2col__item
2 Column Layout @ 60% & 40%          => %l-eq-2col__item--1-2\(60\,40\)
2 Column Layout @ 66.666% & 33.333%  => %l-eq-2col__item--1-2\(66\,33\)
2 Column Layout @ 33.333% & 66.666%  => %l-eq-2col__item--1-2\(33\,66\)
2 Column Layout @ 40% & 60%          => %l-eq-2col__item--1-2\(40\,60\)
2 Column Layout @ 75% & 25%          => %l-eq-2col__item--1-2\(75\,25\)
3 Column Layout @ 33% EACH           => %l-eq-3col__item

section.description:
Generic modifier components. Oftern extended from other components. Each Utility should be very specific and do only 1 job. This seciton also documents Generic Mixins and Extendables

Utility Naming Patterns

.u-utility__element
.u-utility--modifier
.u-utility--modifier__element
.u-utility__element--modifier

Mixin Naming Patterns @TODO

Clearfix from http://cssmojo.com/latest_new_clearfix_so_far/

Use as a class or @extend.

 @extend %u-clearfix; 
 .u-clearfix

Basic styling used in lists Intended for Drupals default menu (ul.menu) / tabs formats to remove default Bullets & display as inline links.

.my-ul-class {
  @extend %u-inline-links;
}

Reset lists to have no bullets and default left padding

.my-ul-class {
  @extend %u-list--reset;
}

Reset lists to have no bullets, no padding or margins.

.my-ul-class {
  @extend %u-list--blank;
}

Remove top and bottom margin from childen elements in a container. This is useful for things like titles in WYSIWYG Fields.

Use as class or @extend (preferred)

 @extend %u-remove-child--margin-top; 
 @extend %u-remove-child--margin-bottom; 
 @extend %u-remove-child--margin-top-bottom; 
 .u-remove-child--margin-top; 
 .u-remove-child--margin-bottom; 
 .u-remove-child--margin-top-bottom;

Hides text in block elements using text-indent. Useful for accessibility in Icon links etc.

Use as class or @extend (preferred)

 @extend %u-text-hide; 
 .u-text-hide

Accessible way to hide elements on the page (and show them again)

Use as a mixin (discouraged), class, or @extend (preferred)

 .u-visually--hidden 
 @extend %u-visually--hidden; 
 @inlude visually-hidden; 
 .u-visually--shown 
 @extend %u-visually--hidden; 
 @inlclude visually-shown;

Animation Extends for CSS transitions

$transition-duration: 0.25s !default;

 @extend %u-animate-background-color 
 @extend %u-animate-color 
 @extend %u-animate-opacity 
 @extend %u-animate-all
Based on http://danielmall.com/articles/responsive-line-breaks/ span does a line break on smaller screens, On larger screens appears inline with a trailing pipe divider

section.description:
Scoped Classes are dependant on the DOM creates a new styling context or Scope. Similar to a Theme, but not necessarily cosmetic, these should be used sparingly—they can be open to abuse and lead to poor CSS if not used wisely.

Scope Naming Patterns

.s-context
section.css: @import 'scope/s-wysiwyg';
